WorkItem.Description: Rawr values spirit way to high for some reason, its very nice for holy but mediocre for disc. You cant select disc priest in model, you auto get holy, so im guessing all gear calculations are done for holy. Can something be done about this?

Comments.Message: Rawr.HolyPriest is intended for, and fully functional and accurate for, both Disciple and Holy priests. Please follow our posting and bug reporting guidelines if you think there's an issue.

for DISC priests: set the Model to Holy, trust me here.
then on the Options tab, "pick your Role" pick one of the DISC style of play you use. (Disc-Tank, Disc-Raid, one of the AUTO-Tanke/Raid, or even one of the SPAM roles.
Lastly, Make sure your talents are set correctly.

everything is now tuned to DISC, and your toons specific role, and talents.  All is good.
What Fyre says is right. Just make sure you got the right talents (Disc spec), and pick the Disc role in question.

Also have to add that when the choices are between Spirit/Crit, Spirit/Haste and Haste/Crit,. Normally Haste/Crit'ing all your gear can get you in trouble even as Disc, and that may be why you suddenly sit with a lot of Spirit. Also normally most socket bonuses are worth it for Disc, giving you a lot of Purified gems. But if you are seeing Int/Spi, Pure Spi and Spp/Spi in red, then you probably have not set up options right. Make sure you have all relevant raid buffs and the rest of the options match up to how you expect to play.

Just in case it helps ... in Rawr 3, the options tab is unfinished and so there isn't a way to choose your roll/rotation. The auto is tank healing with flash heal, but if all/most you're doing is shield spamming, the results will be confusing to novice users (I had this problem myself until I went back and used Rawr 2).

Many thanks for all the hard work!
